meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices isolationism.
meanings.sent1: The isolationists in our class prefer to work alone on projects.
meanings.sent2: The isolationists at the meeting refused to join any group activities.
meanings.sent3: The isolationists decided to have a solo dance party in the corner.
meanings.sent4: The isolationists were like islands in a sea of collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The image of the isolationists sitting apart was etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group or country that seeks to avoid alliances or involvement in international affairs.
meanings.sent1: The isolationists in the world stage kept to themselves and avoided partnerships.
meanings.sent2: The isolationists in the region stayed out of global conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The isolationists threw a party for one and didn't invite any other countries.
meanings.sent4: The isolationists were like lone wolves in the pack of nations.
meanings.sent5: The concept of isolationists closing their borders was hard to forget.
